channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Will 2025 Be The Year The West Frees Itself From All Justin Trudeaus?
item.description: The year 2025 doesn’t appear to favor Western leftist leaders, but it offers significant hope for a revitalization of Western civilization.

item.title: From Citizenship Requirements To Banning ‘Zuckbucks,’ Wyoming’s Elections Chief Pushes Bold 2025 Agenda
item.description: Wyoming Secretary of State Chuck Gray is seeking to advance long-sought election reforms in the state's upcoming legislative session.

item.title: Trump set to face criminal reckoning, but no jail time, on N.Y. convictions
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump will be sentenced Friday by a New York judge for the felony convictions handed down by a Manhattan jury last spring.

item.title: If Californians Don’t Fire Newsom, He’ll Burn What’s Left Of Their Home To The Ground
item.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom failed to prepare California for fires; L.A.’s fire chief was focused on making the fire department 'more diverse.'

item.title: 'Devastating': California had record rainfall last year, but lacked infrastructure to store it
item.description: California's fire crisis stems from outdated water systems and poor forestry management, critics argue, with progressive politics thwarting realistic ...

item.title: Pay Up, Mr. Mann
item.description: A court in our nation’s capital ordered Mann to pay us $530,820.21 worth of attorney’s fees and costs within 30 days.

item.title: California’s DEI-Obsessed Anarchotyrants Threw Money At Everything But Water And Firefighters
item.description: California has enormously expensive and intrusive government that can’t even provide firefighters or water when your neighborhood burns down.

item.title: No-Fault Divorce Paved The Way For New York’s Endorsement Of Infidelity

item.title: Red state AGs welcome Trump crackdown on illegal immigration after four years battling Biden
item.description: Twenty Republican state attorneys general back Trump's impending immigration crackdown, criticizing Biden's policies for weakening border security.

item.title: Trump the Expansionist Knows Real Estate Matters
item.description: Geography isn’t everything, but often when it comes to geopolitics, there’s no substitute for cold, hard acreage.

item.title: The Battle for Religious Liberty Is Far from Over
item.description: Too often, Americans of faith still meet opposition, often from government itself. Over the next four years, the Supreme Court could change this — for...

item.description: President Biden plans to deliver a major foreign policy speech outlining what he believes to be the key parts of his legacy as part of his farewell to...

item.title: What It Takes to Be the Better Man
item.description: The ingenious Robbie Williams biopic is a showbiz landmark.

item.title: Vance resigns from Senate as he and Trump prepare to take office
item.description: Vice President-elect JD Vance resigns from the U.S. Senate as he and President-elect Donald Trump prepare to take office on Jan. 20, 2025.

item.title: The Era of Censored Social Media Is Over — for America
item.description: Brussels, meanwhile, retains the progressive faith in managing democratic outcomes by regulating what can and can’t be said.

item.title: Supreme Court weighs TikTok ban Friday; national security, free speech arguments are considered
item.description: The Supreme Court agreed to fast-track TikTok's request for review, and the Supreme Court hearing comes just nine days before a U.S. ban takes effect.
